top_banner.title: Contact Us
top_banner.description: If you have any questions, would like to collaborate, volunteer, or just want to say hello, please connect with us on Social Media.

items.question: What is Tanweer Festival?
items.answer:
With a mission to foster greater understanding through music, art and poetry, Tanweer Festival is a vibrant celebration which marks the beginning of a new chapter in Sharjah's vibrant cultural landscape.
The festival deepens understanding of heritage, creativity, and wisdom from around the world, connecting diverse cultures through musical expression and creating a wholesome, enriching and celebratory environment for all who attend.
Festival guests can discover workshops, indulge in nourishing culinary delights, explore a vibrant marketplace, and partake in unforgettable experiences that are unprecedented in Sharjah and the region.

items.question: Where is the festival held?
items.answer: The festival is held in Mleiha, Sharjah - United Arab Emirates.

items.question: When is the festival held?
items.answer: The festival is held on 22, 23, and 24 November.

items.question: How long does the festival last?
items.answer: The festival lasts for three days.

items.question: How big is Tanweer Festival?
items.answer: The festival is expected to attract 2,000 people per day who are passionate about music, art and poetry.

items.question: What is the age range for attendees?
items.answer: To maintain the safety of the festival and its guests, Tanweer Festival and its program are designed specifically attendees aged 18 and above.

items.question: Is Tanweer Festival family-friendly?
items.answer: The festival is best enjoyed by adults, so we kindly ask that those aged 17 and under sit this one out. The environment and activities are tailored for an adult audience.

items.question: Are pets allowed at the festival?
items.answer: For the safety of animals and visitors, pets are not allowed at the festival.

items.question: Is the festival wheelchair accessible?
items.answer: The festival is held outdoors on natural terrain, including sand and gravel, which can be difficult for standard wheelchairs. We highly recommend that people of determination bring an all-terrain wheelchair and be accompanied by a responsible adult.

items.question: Do you offer help getting to the festival site from the car parks?
items.answer: Yes, if our main car park is full, a shuttle bus will run between the overflow parking area and the festival gate. We encourage ridesharing to help reduce parking congestion, minimize environmental impact, and make new friends along the way.

items.question: Do you have electric car charging points on-site?
items.answer: Not for our first festival, but we plan to in the future. The festival is in a somewhat remote, natural area.

items.question: Does the festival provide accommodations?
items.answer: The festival does not offer traditional accommodation, but we do have a designated campsite available for those who wish to stay close to the event. Additionally, we've partnered with local hotels and can provide recommendations for lodging. For more information, including campsite details and hotel recommendations, visit www.tanweerfestival.com/stayandactivities*.

items.question: Are there camping options available?
items.answer: Yes, camping is allowed at the festival with your purchase of a festival ticket.

items.question: Can I bring my own instrument and perform at the festival?
items.answer: No, only scheduled performers are allowed to perform at the festival.

items.question: Are there any performance restrictions?
items.answer: Yes, live broadcasting is not allowed during music performances.

items.question: What language are the performances in?
items.answer: Performances may be in a variety of languages, including English and traditional languages of the performers' cultures.

items.question: Will there be translation services available?
items.answer: No, translation services are not available for performances. Please check with the festival staff for more information.

items.question: What kind of music will be on the main stage?
items.answer: Each day, we are showing a variety of traditional and commercial music by world-famous artists.

items.question: How long are the performances for the music artists?
items.answer: The performance of each artist will range from 1 to 1.5 hours.

items.question: Are the workshops hands-on?
items.answer: Some workshops are hands-on, while others may be lecture-style. Please check the workshop descriptions for more information. www.tanweerfestival.com/workshops*.

items.question: Can I attend multiple workshops in one day?
items.answer: Yes, you can attend multiple workshops in one day. Please check our program for more information. www.tanweerfestival.com/programs*.

items.question: What are Tanweer Market timings?
items.answer: 10 am to 10 pm. However, some stands may decide to close earlier.

items.question: Are there any local artisans who sell their products at the market?
items.answer: Yes.

items.question: What types of crafts are available at the market?
items.answer: Tanweer Festival market offers a wide range of crafts, including jewelry, pottery, paintings, woodwork, textiles, and much more.

items.question: Does Tanweer Market accept cash?
items.answer: No. We ONLY accept digital credit/debit card payments.

items.question: Is there parking available for market visitors?
items.answer: Yes, there are designated parking areas for visitors upon arriving at Tanweer Festival. However, parking availability may vary depending on your tickets and the time of the day, so we recommend arriving early.

items.question: Are pets allowed at the market?
items.answer: While we love animals, visitors are requested not to bring their pets to the market (for safety reasons).

items.question: How do I apply to become a vendor at the market?
items.answer: Unfortunately, our vendors have already been selected and we are not currently allocating vendor stands for this year’s event. However, if you are would like to work with us at next year’s event,  please reach out to us via our Instagram account to submit your interest.

items.question: Is there an entrance fee to the market?
items.answer: To access the market, guests must have a festival entry ticket.. For more information visit https://tickets.tanweerfestival.com/*.

items.question: Are there food and beverage options at the marketplace?
items.answer: Yes, we will be having stalls serving beverages and snacks at our NOURISH area.

items.question: Can I bring my chair or blanket to sit on?
items.answer: We advise that each person bring a personal blanket or cushion to sit on. Personal furniture is only allowed in the camping area if you have a ticket and camp pass.

items.question: Can I bring food and drinks into the festival?
items.answer: For safety reasons, outside food and drinks are not allowed at the festival. In case of any special dietary requirements, you may bring your own dehydrated foods as they won't spoil and are more resilient in warm weather.

items.question: Are alcoholic beverages available at the festival?
items.answer: No, alcoholic beverages are not available at the festival.

items.question: Can I bring my water bottle to the festival?
items.answer: Yes, we encourage everyone to bring their own reusable water bottle to the festival. Water refill stations will be available.

items.question: Is there a schedule of events available?
items.answer: Yes, the program is posted on our website. For more information visit. www.tanweerfestival.com/programs*.

items.question: Are there ATMs available at the festival?
items.answer: No, ATMs will not be available at the festival.

items.question: Is there a lost and found at the festival?
items.answer: Yes, we have a lost and found area at the festival.

items.question: Is there a code of conduct for attendees?
items.answer: Yes, we expect all attendees to behave respectfully and responsibly at the festival. Any behavior that is disruptive or disrespectful to performers, facilitators, or other attendees may result in removal from the festival.

items.question: What is the festival's policy on sustainability?
items.answer: The festival is committed to sustainability and reducing its environmental impact. We encourage attendees to bring their own reusable water bottles and bags and to limit their use of single-use plastics.

items.question: Is there a way to give feedback on the festival?
items.answer: Yes, we welcome feedback on the festival. Please contact us through our Instagram account or speak to festival staff at the event.

items.question: Is there a way to get involved with the festival as a volunteer or sponsor?
items.answer: Yes, we have volunteer and sponsorship opportunities available. Please reach out to us through our Instagram account to learn more.

items.question: What if I have additional questions?
items.answer: Please contact us through our Instagram account; we will gladly help you.

items.question: Are there any cultural norms I need to consider as a foreigner visiting the UAE?
items.answer: There will be diverse people of all ages at the festival. You are a guest, and we expect everyone to be sensitive to each other's space and conduct themselves respectfully.

items.question: Are there any cultural norms I need to take into account as a foreign man or woman visiting the UAE?
items.answer: The UAE is one of the most modern and diverse countries in the world. Tanweer Festival is a family-friendly festival whose aim is to create a safe space for all our visitors. Sexually explicit clothing and nudity are prohibited.

items.question: What do I need to bring with me to the festival?
items.answer: Please travel light, ensure you have the right clothes, and carry an electronic payment method. Some workshops will require comfortable clothes, socks, or a blindfold. Your electronic ticket can be printed or stored on your phone. You might want to bring a bottle of water that you can refill (maybe with a hook in case it doesn’t fit your bag).
